review_title: Research institute with the vision of a corporation and science of an academic institution
pros: Excellent minds, generous benefits and packages, availability of resources and the fact that there are several branches located around the world really enhances collaboration and sharing of expertise.
cons: Lack of transparency, administration wields too much power in day-to-day processes and each branch is usually limited in personnel, leaving each branch highly reliant on their host institution.

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in San Diego, CA
pros: nice and friendly environment, great fund support
cons: not too much Cons. A great place for postdoc!

pros: Good work life balance and visibility
cons: Potential for layoffs and lack of growth

pros: The people were kind, never had issues with HR.
cons: there are no issues worth noting

pros: a slightly higher salary as compared to similar job duties
cons: not so stable, it takes longer time to be promoted

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in San Diego, CA
pros:
- Very productive and well-funded institute

job_title: Senior Director, Clinical Data Management in Philadelphia, PA
pros: great company to work for

pros: High level of research activities
cons: Not so well paid in terms of salary and benefits

review_title: Wrong place in the wrong moment!
job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in San Diego, CA
pros: It is an international and exciting institute, where, working with the right people, a postdoc could grow as a person and as a scientist. I think overall it could be a really good place where to do a postdoctoral experience.
cons: It could happen to meet and work with selfish, proud and not really honest supervisor or collaborator. People working in the same team sometimes are fighting and competing against each other instead of collaborating with each other.

pros: A lot of funding is possible, the equipment is brand new. There is a lot of support, working hours are manageble, Labs not crowded. In general friendly atmosphere and it is nice to be in Oxford
cons: Junior PIs, would not recoment for the postdocs as no one seems to get PI positions from here. Would not advice to join big labs if one does not know what he/she is doing.

review_title: Some PIs are awesome, some are horrible
job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Koreatown, Los Angeles
pros: Nice work environment and instruments, the faculty team is super strong with 3 members of the NAS. Some labs produce great papers and new PIs
cons: Some faculty members are nasty to work with, as they treat foreign postdocs harsh like slaves.

pros: very relaxed environment, best weather in the united states. great opportunities to collebriate with the best researchers in the world
cons: as a postdoc researcher, you never know when you would be able to locate a "real" job. Salary could've been higher.

pros:
New equipment
Young principle investigates, so you can get a lot more of their time then more experienced professors.
nice community
Many good talks
cons:
Awful work life balance
Inexperienced staff and professionals
Campus is out of the city
Very little connection between facility and the wider university

pros: In addition to good pay and very flexible work schedule, I was paired up with a postdoctoral researcher and got to assist with research over the summer.
cons: There is nothing about Ludwig Cancer Research that I particularly disliked.

pros: Friendly people, access to UCSD campus resources, and a weekly Friday happy hour!
cons: Only con is there are no retirement benefits for postdocs, but this is a national issue, not just LICR

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: Friendly work environment with scientific excellence as the primary focus.  Many great events for staff and families and competitive benefits.
cons: Not many administrative opportunities but more opportunities in a laboratory.

pros: Excellent management, Top leaders in Cancer Research,
cons: It's shrinking slowly, Should advance more in advanced research tools.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great people, flexibility, great benefits
cons: No chance of advancement, unless on top, may seat on the same job forever

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in La Jolla, CA
pros: Health insurance, vacation/sick benefits, big-name principle investigators (members of NAS)
cons: Arrogant principle investigator(s), politics, poorly structured

job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher in San Diego, CA
pros: Growing institution, no funding problems, most of them are well known scientist.
cons: Difficult to get promoted or get a permanent position inside of the Institution.

review_title: It is an ordinary postdoc position
pros: Good pension, relax environment, nice people
cons: Not so much interaction with other branches of Ludwig Institute around the world.

review_title: Good option for a family oriented person, bad for career growth
pros: Flexibility, no pressure, good health insurance
cons: no career advancement, little team work
